haxel.HxlTilemap

type
class
extends
HxlObject
This is a traditional tilemap display and collision class. It takes a string of comma-separated numbers and then associates those values with tiles from the sheet you pass in. It also includes some handy static parsers that can convert arrays or PNG files into strings that can be successfully loaded.

Static Variables

public ALT : Int

Top-down auto-tiling.

public AUTO : Int

Platformer-friendly auto-tiling.

public ImgAuto : Class<flash.display.Bitmap>

public ImgAutoAlt : Class<flash.display.Bitmap>

public OFF : Int

No auto-tiling.

Static Methods

public arrayToCSV(Data : Array<Int>, Width : Int) : String

parameters
Data An array full of integer tile references.
Width The number of tiles in each row.
returns
A comma-separated string containing the level data in a FlxTilemap-friendly format.
Converts a one-dimensional array of tile data to a comma-separated string.

Constructor

public new()
The tilemap constructor just initializes some basic variables.

public moves : Bool

inherited from haxel.HxlObject
Set this to false if you want to skip the automatic motion/movement stuff (see updateMotion()). FlxObject and FlxSprite default to true. FlxText, FlxTileblock, FlxTilemap and FlxSound default to false.

public origin : HxlPoint

inherited from haxel.HxlObject
WARNING: The origin of the sprite will default to its center. If you change this, the visuals and the collisions will likely be pretty out-of-sync if you do any rotation.

public right(getRight,null) : Float

inherited from haxel.HxlRect

public right(getRight,null) : Float

inherited from haxel.HxlRect

public scrollFactor : HxlPoint

inherited from haxel.HxlObject
A point that can store numbers from 0 to 1 (for X and Y independently) that governs how much this object is affected by the camera subsystem. 0 means it never moves, like a HUD element or far background graphic. 1 means it scrolls along a the same speed as the foreground layer. scrollFactor is initialized as (1,1) by default.

public solid(getSolid,setSolid) : Bool

inherited from haxel.HxlObject

public startingIndex : Int

The first index of your tile sheet (default: 0) If you want to change it, do so before calling loadMap().

public thrust : Float

inherited from haxel.HxlObject
If you want to do Asteroids style stuff, check out thrust, instead of directly accessing the object's velocity or acceleration.

public tileClass : Class<HxlTile>

parameters

public follow(?Border : Int) : Void

parameters
Border Adjusts the camera follow boundary by whatever number of tiles you specify here. Handy for blocking off deadends that are offscreen, etc. Use a negative number to add padding instead of hiding the edges.
Call this function to lock the automatic camera to the map's edges.

private generateBoundingTiles() : Void

Generates a bounding box version of the tiles, flixel should call this automatically when necessary.

Set alpha to a number between 0 and 1 to change the opacity of the tilemap.

public loadMap(MapData : Array<Array<Int>>, TileGraphic : Class<flash.display.Bitmap>, ?TileWidth : Int, ?TileHeight : Int, ?RowWidth : Int) : HxlTilemap

parameters
MapData 2d array of Ints, specifies index of sprite to use from TileGraphic.
TileGraphic All the tiles you want to use, arranged in a strip corresponding to the numbers in MapData.
TileWidth The width of your tiles (e.g. 8) - defaults to height of the tile graphic if unspecified.
TileHeight The height of your tiles (e.g. 8) - defaults to width if unspecified.
returns
A pointer this instance of HxlTilemap, for chaining as usual :)
Load the tilemap with string data and a tile graphic.

inherited from haxel.HxlObject
returns
Whether the object is on screen or not.
Check and see if this object is currently on screen.

public overlapsPoint(X : Float, Y : Float, ?PerPixel : Bool) : Bool

inherited from haxel.HxlObject
parameters
X The X coordinate of the point.
Y The Y coordinate of the point.
PerPixel Whether or not to use per pixel collision checking (only available in HxlSprite subclass).
returns
Whether or not the point overlaps this object.
Checks to see if a point in 2D space overlaps this HxlObject object.

public ray(StartX : Float, StartY : Float, EndX : Float, EndY : Float, Result : HxlPoint, ?Resolution : Int) : Bool

parameters
StartX The X component of the ray's start.
StartY The Y component of the ray's start.
EndX The X component of the ray's end.
EndY The Y component of the ray's end.
Result A Point object containing the first wall impact.
Resolution Defaults to 1, meaning check every tile or so. Higher means more checks!
returns
Whether or not there was a collision between the ray and a colliding tile.
Shoots a ray from the start point to the end point. If/when it passes through a tile, it stores and returns that point.

public render() : Void

overrides haxel.HxlObject
Draws the tilemap.

private renderTilemap() : Void

Internal function that actually renders the tilemap. Called by render().
